summary: This mod adjusts fast travel timescale for more realism.
descriptionHtml:
Did you ever find that vanilla fast travel is too fast? It takes about three in-game hours to go move from Witherun to Windhelm... just without talking about horses. Thi is generally the reason for many users do not use fast travel and prefer a realistic walk, even if walking for the same road several times can be [b]very[/b] annoyng.
I tried to use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19389/]Fast travel timescale fix[/url] by Hexaae, but for me it increased the speed, so fast travel became a real teleport. So I decided to make my own mod.

If you use immersive/realistic mods like [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/11163/]Frostfall[/url] and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26228/]RND[/url], you sholdn't miss this mod too.

[b]WHAT THIS MOD DOES[/b]
[i]Realistic Fast Travel[/i] sets the speed multiplier to 0.437500 (vanilla is 1.000000).
I adjusted the speed of fast travel so it fits exactly the time it would take [i]walking[/i] from a place to another.

[b]INSTALL/UNINSTALL[/b]
Use NMM or simply put the "[i]Realistic Fast Travel.esp[/i]" file in your C:/.../Skyrim/Data folder.
Delete the .esp file or use NMM to uninstall.

[b]CONFLICTS[/b]
All mods that modify [i]fFastTravelSpeedMult[/i] value.
If you use Frostfall, I suggest to disable Frostfall's fast travel manager with MCM.

[b]LANGUAGES[/b]
No strings are modified in this mod, so it'is compatible with all languages!
author: ArgoE11
